intro: Trigonella stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with small yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to fenugreek. The botanical features of Trigonella stenocarpa make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
